commented_code:
After this you should have everything installed and can proceed to running ComfyUI.
 
+
+## Docker
+
+There are prebuilt docker images for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs on [GitHub Packages](https://ghcr.io/comfyanonymous/comfyui).
+
+You can pull them to your local docker registry with:
+
+```shell
+# For NVIDIA GPUs
+docker pull ghcr.io/comfyanonymous/comfyui:latest-cu124
+# For AMD GPUs
+docker pull ghcr.io/comfyanonymous/comfyui:latest-rocm6.2
+
+# For CPU only
+docker pull ghcr.io/comfyanonymous/comfyui:latest-cpu
+```
+

discussion_comments.comment_body:
> Suggest a better location for this section or is the current location good enough?

Looking at the README.md structure, I think we can improve the placement of the Release Process section. Currently, it's placed quite early in the document, right after the initial introduction and before the "Get Started" section.
I suggest moving it after the "Features" section and before the "Shortcuts" section. Here's why:
The current flow goes: Introduction → Release Process → Get Started → Features → Shortcuts
A more logical flow would be: Introduction → Get Started → Features → Release Process → Shortcuts
This reorganization would:
Keep all user-focused content (getting started, features) together at the top
Group the more technical/development-focused content (release process, shortcuts) together
Create a better progression from basic to advanced information

Section moved.
